context: The Estonian word 'tükkideks' is the illative plural form of 'tükki', meaning 'into pieces'. It indicates that something has been broken down or divided into smaller parts. This adverbial form shows the result or manner in which an action occurs - when something breaks apart or is broken, it becomes 'tükkideks'. The word is commonly used with motion verbs or as a resultative complement to indicate fragmentation.
